content.html:
Students will complete the following questions to practice the skills they have learned in this lesson.

  1. Enter the given data into Desmos, then calculate the regression approximation to determine the curve of best fit.

\(x_1\)

\(y_1\)

2

56

5

116

8

155

11

205

17

230

(Students were provided access to Desmos with a set x-axis of \(-10 < x < 50\) and a set y-axis of \(-60 < y < 350)\).

What is the equation for the curve of best fit that models the data?

  • \(y = -0.93x^2+ 22.63x + 10.48\)
  • \(y = -0.69x^2+ 24.83x + 8.07\)
  • \(y = -3.11x^2+ 16.32x + 8.94\)
  • \(y = -0.7x^2 + 35.93x + 8.19\)

Answer: \(y = -0.69x^2+ 24.83x + 8.07\)

(Students were provided access to Desmos with a set x-axis of \(-10 < x < 50\) and a set y-axis of \(-60 < y < 350)\).

What is the equation for the curve of best fit that models the data?

  • \(y = -0.56x^2+ 38.74x + 5.31\)
  • \(y = -2.31x^2+ 24.711x + 3.25\)
  • \(y = -0.62x^2+ 17.45x + 9.64\)
  • \(y = -0.74x^2+ 34.32x + 7.44\)

Answer: \(y = -0.74x^2+ 34.32x + 7.44\)

(Students were provided access to Desmos with a set x-axis of \(-10 < x < 50\) and a set y-axis of \(-60 < y < 350)\).

What is the equation for the curve of best fit that models the data?

  • \(y = -6.3x^2+ 8x + 10.6\)
  • \(y = -3.1x^2+ 2.6x + 7.93\)
  • \(y = -4.31x^2+ 3.2x + 6.08\)
  • \(y = -5.1x^2 + 9.2x + 7.14\)

Answer: \(y = -4.31x^2+ 3.2x + 6.08\)

(Students were provided access to Desmos with a set x-axis of \(-10 < x < 50\) and a set y-axis of \(-60 < y < 350)\).

What is the equation for the curve of best fit that models the data?

  • \( y = -25.41x^2+ 59.28x + 9.64\)
  • \(y = -30.84x^2+ 49.61x + 8.99\)
  • \(y = -3.72x^2 + 7.34x + 8.67\)
  • \(y = -35.78x^2+ 45.21x + 3.74\)

Answer: \(y = -25.41x^2+ 59.28x + 9.64\)

For questions 5–9, use the following information.

The path of a toy rocket after launch is modeled by the following data set.

The height of the rocket, in feet, \(y\), corresponds to the number of seconds passed, \(x\).

  1. What is the equation for the curve of best fit that models the flight of the toy rocket?
  • \( y = -6.1x^2+ 31x + 1.24\)
  • \(y = -11.9x^2+ 30.2x + 3.64\)
  • \(y = -4.2x^2 + 34x + 6.34\)
  • \(y = -9.2x^2+ 46x + 3.51\)

Answer: \(y = -9.2x^2+ 46x + 3.51\)

  1. Approximately how high will the rocket be 2 seconds after launch?
  • 45.91 feet
  • 53.60 feet
  • 58.71 feet
  • 61.00 feet

Answer: 58.71 feet

  1. At what approximate times after launch will the rocket have a height of 20 feet?
  • 0.26 seconds after launch and 4.74 seconds after launch
  • 0.39 seconds after launch and 4.61 seconds after launch
  • 0.52 seconds after launch and 4.48 seconds after launch
  • 0.82 seconds after launch and 4.18 seconds after launch

Answer: 0.39 seconds after launch and 4.61 seconds after launch

  1. Approximately how long will it take the rocket to reach its maximum height?
  • 1.73 seconds
  • 2.50 seconds
  • 3.20 seconds
  • 5.08 seconds

Answer: 2.50 seconds

  1. Approximately how long will it take for the rocket to land on the ground?
  • 2.50 seconds
  • 4.63 seconds
  • 5.08 seconds
  • 6.12 seconds

Answer: 5.08 seconds

For question 10, Maria has found a curve of best fit using the technology (Students were provided access to Desmos)

  1. Maria is asked to predict the \(y\)-value on her curve when \(x = 10\). To do this, she graphs the function \(x = 10\) and analyzes the intersection point of the curve and the line.

What is the \(y\)-value Maria is asked to predict?

  • 10
  • 93
  • 105
  • 111

Answer: 111
